Text:
...That's when I said, "I'll take care of this.
You go on ahead!"
My! What a lovely tale!

...Oh dear, your glass is empty. What would you like
to drink next, Lord Margrave?

Many thanks. Ah, but this is quite surreal having
drinks with the best-selling author Natsume Kafka.
I'm deeply humbled.

Oh, please. Your stories are all so fascinating, Lord
Margrave. They give me inspiration for my novels!

Oh? How flattering. Well then, for my next story...
Yes, why don't I tell you about the recent rise in
low-class aristocrats?

I've heard about that. Apparently, once-insignificant
aristocrats have suddenly increased their assets and
risen to the ranks of the voter class.

Very impressive, Lady Natsume. You have your ear to
the ground. It seems they all made a fortune through
a certain casino.

(It wouldn't hurt to dig deeper into this intel about
a casino in the capital.)

Sounds like quite the lucky break. But how does one
amass such a fortune to become a voter?

I've only been there once myself. You see, the casino
is notorious for its incredibly high rates. It costs
no small sum to play at their tables.

I don't know why they operate that way, but one can
assume there are those willing to take high risks for
high returns.

(It could just be some high-end, exclusive casino,
but the Cult is often behind high-value transactions.
It sounds like something we ought to investigate...)

(Admission into the casino seems more challenging
than anticipated, but that's no excuse not to look
into somewhere that could provide us with a lead
to the Cult.)

That sounds like a highly suspicious...I mean, deeply
fascinating story that stokes my creativity. Would
you take me there sometime?

Well, while I'd be happy to lend you my assistance,
the truth is even I cannot gain access so easily.
What? Even someone such as yourself, Lord Margrave?

Indeed... They have quite the screening process.
The one time I visited, I was really only allowed
entry as I was accompanying a duke.

Ideally, it would be best to receive an introduction
from, or accompany someone close to, the royal
family...
I see... Someone close to the royal family...

(Well...I know a certain someone who's not only
"close to" but "part of" the royal family...)

(Besides...just the thought of asking that woman for
a favor...!)

...In any case, how about the two of us visit a more
affordable casino together—
Absolutely not!
Huh?

What? Oh, I wasn't referring to you, Lord Margrave.
My mind wandered for a moment... Ahahah!
Y-You surprised me there! Ha-hahaha...

(The casino is the most suspicious intel from today.
It seems more challenging than anticipated, but I
can't ignore somewhere that could provide us with
a lead to the Cult.)

(Since a formal introduction or accompanying someone
from the royal family isn't really an option, I'd best
think of another way. Let's see...)
...Hm? This advert is for the very same casino...
...Th-That's it!
A few days later...
Welcome to our casino! Have a welcome drink!

On your left are the card tables! And on your right
are the roulette tables!

Please feel free to join in or spectate! Just follow
the rules and have fun at the tables! Enjoy!
...Whew.

(I lucked out coming across that poster advert
recruiting staff!)

(Being the high-class casino it is, the required
skills were set high, but...)

(I managed to falsify my documents with Gamma's help.
The interview itself was a cakewalk, thanks to that
and my silver tongue!)

(That said, there was a lot to pick up beforehand,
and it wasn't easy learning all the casino etiquette
and rules of the games...but, thanks to that, I can
move about with ease now.)

Let me take your empty glass. What would you like to
drink next?
Here's how this game works...

Please exchange your chips over there! See you again
soon!

...Whew. I might've taken my cover a little too
seriously.

I have a bad habit of getting wrapped up in whatever
I'm doing. I ought to ease up—
N-No way!
Huh?! What is going on?
N-No way! Lemme do it again!
Sir, you're inconveniencing the other customers...

Gimme back the money I gambled! I'll settle for just
half! It's all I've got!

(Judging from the looks of it, he gambled big and
lost all his money. He's making a scene now that
he's broke.)

(Based on my research, each game is based on solid
theories and rates of return.)

(So long as you maintain strict self-discipline, you
shouldn't lose too much money, but...)

(Well, I guess someone has to lose to make the rise
in low-class aristocrats a reality.)
All right, time to get back to work—
Hold on! I-Isn't that?!
